decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By using cards like Force of Will, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Swords to Plowshares, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. The deck also includes card draw and filtering spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure it has access to the right cards at the right time. Overall, the deck is designed to outlast and outmaneuver its opponent in a game of attrition.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced strategy of using artifacts to generate mana and control the board while quickly building up storm count for a big finish with Aetherflux Reservoir. It includes a mix of low-cost artifacts for mana acceleration like Mox Opal and Grim Monolith, as well as card draw engines like Urza's Bauble and Mishra's Bauble to keep the engine running smoothly. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Paradox Engine provide additional synergy with artifacts, allowing for explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of card advantage and powerful spells.

The main objective of this Belcher deck is to quickly assemble the necessary mana sources and spells to cast Goblin Charbelcher and activate its ability to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck includes numerous fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, as well as ritual spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate mana quickly. It also utilizes cards like Entomb and Gaea's Will to set up the combo and protect it from disruption. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Archon of Cruelty, and Murktide Regent, then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield. It also includes control elements like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to win by creating a powerful board presence early on and overwhelming the opponent with big threats. It efficiently combines graveyard synergy with disruptive elements to create a strong reanimator strategy.

This mono black aggro deck revolves around disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while efficiently removing threats with Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck aims to apply pressure quickly with aggressive creatures like Barrowgoyf, Nethergoyf, and Dauthi Voidwalker, while utilizing Mishra's Bauble for card advantage. The inclusion of lands like Wasteland and Nihil Spellbomb helps to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, disruptive aggression to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck aims to quickly and efficiently combo off by milling the entire deck using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, while utilizing cards like Pact of Negation to protect the combo. The key concept revolves around utilizing multiple acceleration cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to quickly play out the combo pieces and win the game by milling the opponent's entire library and then using Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck is designed to be fast and consistent, aiming to win before the opponent can effectively disrupt the combo.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counter spells and removals while also utilizing the combo of Phyrexian Dreadnought and Stiflenought to quickly end the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Doorkeeper Thrull serves as a backup win condition. The mana base is primarily focused on fetching the necessary colors for spells and lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to stall the game long enough to assemble its key combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on a aggressive playstyle with efficient creatures like Questing Druid, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and counter spells like Force of Will, while still maintaining a fast tempo with cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler. The mana base is optimized for casting spells quickly and efficiently, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation tools like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure consistency and adaptability in different matchups.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast and explosive combo using low-cost spells and creatures to quickly mill through the library and win the game in one turn. It heavily relies on rituals, fast mana, and tutors to find key pieces such as Balustrade Spy or Undercity Informer to empty the library, then use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle or another win condition to secure the victory. The deck aims to win before the opponent can disrupt the combo, making it a high-risk, high-reward strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.
